**Description:** Adds two new experimental features: a Developer Mood Tracker and a Team Productivity Analyzer.  These tools provide valuable insights into developer well-being and team productivity, enabling data-driven improvements to workflows and processes.
**Performance Impact:** low_impact
**Security Risk:** none
**Maintainability:** unchanged

**Design Rationale:** The introduction of the Developer Mood Tracker and Team Productivity Analyzer aims to improve team efficiency and overall well-being.  By analyzing commit messages and code changes, the Mood Tracker offers insights into individual developer sentiment. The Productivity Analyzer complements this by providing a broader team-level productivity assessment based on various metrics (commits, PR merges, bug fixes, etc.). These tools enable proactive identification of potential bottlenecks or morale issues, leading to more effective interventions. The design uses emoji-based feedback for intuitive interpretation and straightforward reporting for team standups and stakeholder summaries.  Further sophistication, such as more robust sentiment analysis, is planned for future iterations.
**Change Type:** feature

ai.title: feat: Add Team Productivity Analyzer and Code Health Monitor
ai.body:
This PR introduces a new suite of experimental tools to analyze team productivity and code health.  The following components have been added:

* **Team Productivity Analyzer:** This tool analyzes various metrics to provide insights into team efficiency and identify potential bottlenecks.  It includes a new file (`TeamProductivityAnalyzer.js`) and a supporting file (`TeamProductivityAnalyzer new.js`).
* **Code Health Monitor:** This component monitors code quality metrics such as code complexity, code smells, and test coverage to identify areas for improvement (`src/experimental/CodeHealthMonitor.js`).
* **Developer Mood Tracker (Experimental):**  This experimental feature attempts to gauge developer sentiment based on commit messages and other factors (`src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js`).

The implementation uses a significant number of new `.json` files within the `.codescribe/history` directory to store the historical data collected by these tools. The `codescribe.log` file has also been updated to reflect the addition of these tools.  These improvements are designed to enhance team efficiency and code quality.  Further development and refinement are expected in subsequent iterations.

**Note:** The Developer Mood Tracker is highly experimental and results should be interpreted cautiously.  Its accuracy will improve as we collect more data.
ai.summary: This PR adds experimental tools for analyzing team productivity and code health, including a Team Productivity Analyzer and a Code Health Monitor.

pr.title: feat: Add Team Productivity Analyzer and Code Health Monitor
pr.body:
This PR introduces a new suite of experimental tools to analyze team productivity and code health.  The following components have been added:

* **Team Productivity Analyzer:** This tool analyzes various metrics to provide insights into team efficiency and identify potential bottlenecks.  It includes a new file (`TeamProductivityAnalyzer.js`) and a supporting file (`TeamProductivityAnalyzer new.js`).
* **Code Health Monitor:** This component monitors code quality metrics such as code complexity, code smells, and test coverage to identify areas for improvement (`src/experimental/CodeHealthMonitor.js`).
* **Developer Mood Tracker (Experimental):**  This experimental feature attempts to gauge developer sentiment based on commit messages and other factors (`src/experimental/DeveloperMoodTracker.js`).

The implementation uses a significant number of new `.json` files within the `.codescribe/history` directory to store the historical data collected by these tools. The `codescribe.log` file has also been updated to reflect the addition of these tools.  These improvements are designed to enhance team efficiency and code quality.  Further development and refinement are expected in subsequent iterations.

**Note:** The Developer Mood Tracker is highly experimental and results should be interpreted cautiously.  Its accuracy will improve as we collect more data.
